Walnut seems opaque but when blown thin or applied in very thin stringers it will show its translucent quality. It can be worked for long periods of time without encasement and with heavy manipulation. This is one of the staple colors in the earth toned palette Glass Alchemy has to offer." - Mike Shelbo

glassitems.name: Wood Glue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: ﻿This pastel based color is back by popular demand!! Wood Glue is a sibling of Glue Stick, with a little extra something to give it a great neutral color. Working Tip: Be sure not to get this color too hot when in a thin application as to not cook out the pastel base and turn it transparent. Blow outs work best of the pastel colors. Note: Thomas' Test Lab contains good quality glass. The color formulation is still not final and final QC parameters have not been set.

glassitems.name: Yellow Crayon
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Yellow Crayon is a dense, bright cadmium based school bus yellow. It is great for all applications and will remain dense when pulled down thin. Try Acid Yellow Crayon if you are looking for a little more kick in your color. Working Tip: Pre-heat in outer flame. Avoid rapid heating. Artist Description by Mike Shelbo: "This color is a true yellow opaque. It's very natural and has an earthy tone to it. Not too dark, not too bright, Yellow Crayon is just right. Works like other crayon colors and prefers to be in the mid to outer region of the flame but can come close to the torch tip in quick passes and light repeated spot heats. The color density holds well in stringers, canework, and murrine. Blowing with Yellow Crayon works well with encasement or color on the surface of your piece and will stay dense until the color layer is blown thinner than 1mm. Compliments and contrasts with almost the entire Glass Alchemy palette, try Yellow Crayon, 304 and Tiger's Eye, 8595 for bumblebees or with Shamrock, 4494 for a classic combo." - Mike Shelbo

glassitems.name: Zen
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Zen is a beautiful soft aqua blue-green that adds a tranquil touch to the pastel line-up. Zen is a pastel version of Tonic, and does contain copper. For a copper free version, try Nimbus. Working Tip: Work neutral to oxidizing for best results. A reducing flame will cause REDuction. While this color can be worked without encasement, for longer working times, we recommend a thin sleeve of clear. Be sure not to get this color too hot when in a thin application as to not cook out the pastel base and turn it transparent. Blow outs work best of the pastel colors.

glassitems.name: Acadian Night
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Our newest batch of Acadian Night is a sparkle color with a blue hue and silver striking effect.

glassitems.name: Acadian Night (Dense Silver)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Acadian Night is a dense sparkle color with a blue hue and silver striking effect.

glassitems.name: Blue Cheese
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A true staple of the Greasy collection, Blue Cheese is a Creamy opaque blue that really pops.

glassitems.name: Blue Satin
glassitems.manufacturer_description: One of our classic colors. A royal blue color with a satin sheen.

glassitems.name: Chocolate Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Chocolate Opal features many vibrant hues that shift in different light spectrums, from deep purple to brilliant brown.

glassitems.name: Chocolate Opal (Dense)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A dense version of our Chocolate Opal, this color looks purple or brown in different lights.

glassitems.name: Creme Brulee
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A Creamy color that can be used in multiple applications.

glassitems.name: Dark Wildberry Satin
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Darker variety of Wildberry with satin chatoyancy. This shade is nice and dark when solid, and can be sleeved or thinned for a more transparent or translucent finish.

glassitems.name: Dense Glopal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a odd batch of dense Glopal rod with a slight satin.

glassitems.name: Dense Orange Opal (Unique)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a dense opal orange color with slight satin. Best worked in a gentle flame or encased.

glassitems.name: Dense Pineapple Juice
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a lovely dense cadmium yellow based color.

glassitems.name: Dense Rose Quartz
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Dense Rose Quartz is a dense version Rose Quartz with extra milky opal effect. Under CFL it goes to a more intense electric hot pink.

glassitems.name: Diet Blue Cheese (Variant)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a variant of our diet blue cheese. A lighter version of our classic blue cheese.

glassitems.name: Euro
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A clear that glows blue under UV.

glassitems.name: Exp. Black
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Greasy Glass black rod. Our black consists of a super dense Wildberry variable. When thinned or exposed to bright backlight the color can show blue/purple. Keep dense for the most black affect.

glassitems.name: Exp. Black Pearl
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Experience the beauty of the Exp. Black Pearl Rod - a stunning, rod with an opalescent finish and a satin feel. Slowly pre heat rod and work it gently.

glassitems.name: Exp. Blood Orange
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Vibrant transparent orange. There are some subtle variations in the strike from yellow to red and orange.

glassitems.name: Exp. Blood Red
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Bright yet deep toned transparent red rod that really pops.

glassitems.name: Exp. Blood Red (unique)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Bright yet deep transparent red rod that really pops. This unique batch varies slightly in tone from the original, almost in the direction of a red orange though still definitely in the Blood Red family.

glassitems.name: Exp. Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Light in shade transparent blue.

glassitems.name: Exp. Blue Phoenix
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A blue striking opal color that produces a range of hues from red to purple.

glassitems.name: Exp. Blueberry Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a navy blue color in the same family as sonic.

glassitems.name: Exp. Bronze Pearl
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A Stunning experimental bronze colored extremely metallic looking color with opalescence to rival a pearl. Bronze Pearl shimmers and shines like a brilliant sparkle color, and also contains depth from the opal effect. This unique batch may have variations in color, and crystal size.

glassitems.name: Exp. Cinnabar
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A dense orange cadmium based color.

glassitems.name: Exp. Coral
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a cadmium based orange that looks similar to the marine invertebrates at the bottom of the sea.

glassitems.name: Exp. Coraline Satin
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Coraline Satin is a cadmium red satin color worked best in a gentle flame or encased. This is a limited batch available while supplies last.

glassitems.name: Exp. Cosmos
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A silver striking black that produces a range of colors.

glassitems.name: Exp. Dark Blue Raspberry
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Intriguing dark striking rod combining a medium saturation cobalt blue and a strong transparent ruby that strikes in the flame as well as the kiln.

glassitems.name: Exp. Dark Green Pearl
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Similar to Bronze Pearl, this Experimental Dark Green version appears dark and mysterious.

glassitems.name: Exp. Dense Coral (variant)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is similar to our coral but a little bit more opaque. Best worked in a gentle flame or encased.

glassitems.name: Exp. Dense Green Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A cadmium based green opal that is a tad more dense than our Exp. Green Opal. This color works best in neutral to oxidizing flames or encased. This is the only batch of Dense Green Opal from 2025.

glassitems.name: Exp. Dense Yellow Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a vivid yellow with opal qualities. Color works best in a neutral to oxidizing flame or encased.

glassitems.name: Exp. Dense Yellow Opal (unique)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This Exp. Dense Yellow Opal Rod is an ideal choice for a one-of-a-kind piece. Its unique mustard color and dense opal structure provide a visually striking effect.

glassitems.name: Exp. Desert Rose
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a cadmium-based orange with pinkish blush tones. Works best in a gentle flame or encased.

glassitems.name: Exp. Green Olive
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is an experimental green color, best worked gently in neutral to oxidizing flames or encased.

glassitems.name: Exp. Green Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A cadmium based green opal. This color works best in neutral to oxidizing flames or encased.

glassitems.name: Exp. Green Opal (Dense)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a one of our new green opal colors, this is a dense batch.

glassitems.name: Exp. Green Opal (unique)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A cadmium based green opal. This color works best in neutral to oxidizing flames or encased. This batch is slightly different than the original.

glassitems.name: Exp. Light Blue Crimson
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Exp. Light Blue Crimson is a flame striking red with a light blue cobalt base.

glassitems.name: Exp. Light Orange Rainbow
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This color can produce a range of colors. Samples were struck in the kiln at 1125 for a short amount of time.

glassitems.name: Exp. Orange
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A vivid semi transparent cadmium based orange.

glassitems.name: Exp. Pearl
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is an Experimental batch of our reformulated "Pearl" series. This color produces metallic like effects that vary depending on how it is worked. To keep color more silver/bronze work it in a gentle flame or encased. If worked hot you can burn out the pearl to create an amber effect on the surface.

glassitems.name: Exp. Pink Grapefruit
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is an experimental orange/pink cadmium color with similarities to orange opal.

glassitems.name: Exp. Poofs (Dense)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A cadmium based orange works best in neutral flame.

glassitems.name: Exp. Sonic Satin (Dense)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Our classic sonic with a satin twist.

glassitems.name: Exp. Transparent Green
glassitems.manufacturer_description: An experimental transparent green. Best worked in an oxidizing flame or encased.

glassitems.name: Exp. Yellow Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Our newest batch of yellow opal rod. A vivid cadmium yellow with opal qualities best worked in a soft flame or encased.

glassitems.name: Globalt
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Global is a light cobalt color that glows a strong blue under UV light.

glassitems.name: Glopal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Glopal is an easy to work and stable opal with a pink UV glow. Milky opaque appearance to unworked tube, with UV glow and opal quality allowing for more or less transparency depending on working conditions. Use a hotter flame for more transparent finish and less heat for a more opaque final product. A thin layer of clear adds durability for higher temp flames and sculpting.

glassitems.name: Gold Purple
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A gold based purple opal color. Color needs to be full worked for purple to strike. To avoid hazing on gold colors work in neutral to oxidizing flame or encase.

glassitems.name: Grease Stain
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A silver based striking color.

glassitems.name: Grease Stain (Light Strike)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A yellowish color with light silver striking characteristics.

glassitems.name: Green Energy (Light Strike)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a silver striking green, you can get a range of color from due to the striking properties.

glassitems.name: Ice Water (UV)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This icy looking transparent glows pink under blacklight. A subtle hint of satin creates the ice water effect, resulting in a standalone clear transparent, or as a component in building layered colored tubes.

glassitems.name: Icy Blue Satin
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A icy blue with a satin shimmer and Uv reactive.

glassitems.name: Jungle Juice (variant)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Jungle Juice is a rich dark green color with sparkle effect. Work gently and does not like deep encasements.

glassitems.name: Light Bright
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A clear that glows Pink/Orange under Uv light.

glassitems.name: Light Olive Oil
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A transparent yellow with slight opal affect.

glassitems.name: Light Phoenix
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Light Phoenix appears as a bright and rich ruby red. Very similar shade of red as standard Phoenix with a finished appearance closer to a traditional ruby red than an opal version. This is a perfect option when seeking a true transparent red that shines bright. Light Phoenix may appear transparent clear when working and before annealing. For a faster strike, raise kiln temperature as high as 1100.

glassitems.name: Light Russet
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A light brown with a slit tint of orange.

glassitems.name: Mango
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Mango is a vibrant translucent yellow orange in the pineapple juice family. Best worked in a gentle flame or encased.

glassitems.name: Marina
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Crisp aquatic blue reminiscent of a clear pond on a bright summer day, Marina is a copper based opal blue. Marina is similar to and in the family of Hydro. Like all opal type colors, it will appear more transparent when worked hotter and more milky when worked cooler. This new batch is slightly more transparent than the last batch.

glassitems.name: Marina (Dense)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A denser batch than our classic Marina. Works best in neutral to oxidizing flames or encased.

glassitems.name: Moist Raspberry
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A striking red, for best results flame strike then kiln strike.

glassitems.name: Moist Raspberry (Unique)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This Moist Raspberry (Unique) Rod adds a vibrant pop of color to any project with its flame striking ruby red hue.

glassitems.name: Neo Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Our classic Neo Opal Rod a translucent purple color with opal properties.

glassitems.name: Neo Opal (Dense)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A more dense version of our classic Neo Opal.

glassitems.name: Opal Light
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Opal Light is a lighter variety of Gopal with the same working characteristics. It has less opal strike which makes this a good color for overlay variations.

glassitems.name: Peach Opal Agate
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Lovely pinkish opal color that verges into an occasional amber.

glassitems.name: Phoenix
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Phoenix is juicy opal red color in the range of ruby with flashes of purple. Phoenix can produce a range of colors depending on strike.

glassitems.name: Pineapple
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Pineapple is a light yellow cadmium color worked best in a gentle neutral flame.

glassitems.name: Pumpkin
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A cadmium based color in similar shade to that of a pumpkin.

glassitems.name: Purple Rainbow (unique)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A unique Striking purple rainbow. Wonderful silver based striking effect in this transparent purple. Work this color using flame chemistry in between neutral and oxidizing to maintain transparency. Strike using a slightly reducing flame or by leaving to soak in the kiln. Note that raising the temperature of the kiln is not always necessary for striking purple rainbow. 1080F for 3 - 4 hours

glassitems.name: Rainbow Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: The Rainbow Opal Rod adds a unique level of color and shimmer in the flame with its opalescent rainbow color shift. It works in both oxidizing and neutral atmospheres and contains a combination of opal and cfl to maximize color enhancement. Its striking effects add a vibrant decorative touch to any glass design.

glassitems.name: Rose Quartz
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Rose Quartz is a lovely transparent pink with slight opal effect. Under CFL it goes to a more intense pink.

glassitems.name: Rose Quartz (Transparent)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Transparent Rose Quartz is a lovely intense transparent pink with CFL reactivity. Under CFL it goes to a more intense electric hot pink.

glassitems.name: Russet
glassitems.manufacturer_description: One of our newest browns added to the pallet. Works best in neutral flame.

glassitems.name: Russet Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A light brown with opal qualities.

glassitems.name: Shifty Peach Light Opal Satin
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Shifts from peach to pink under cfl, has a light opal and satin

glassitems.name: Silver Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A silver based opal color.

glassitems.name: Smog
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A blue grey, with similarities to the hydro family with out the copper properties.

glassitems.name: Sonic
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Sonic is a rich blue opal. Similar in color to Dense Blue Cheese with an opal effect throughout.

glassitems.name: Sparkle
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Shiny metallic sparkle color. This is a great blingy sparkle rod in a classic gray metallic shade. Sparkle is a no-chrome metallic flake meaning it can be worked in any setting, surface or deep encasement.

glassitems.name: Transitional Cinnabar
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a semitransparent cadmium based orange, best worked in neutral to gentle oxidizing flames or encased.

glassitems.name: Transitional Mango
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Mango is a vibrant translucent yellow orange in the pineapple juice family. Best worked in a gentle flame or encased. This batch is more transparent then the last with a slight satin.

glassitems.name: Transitional Phoenix
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A red color with slight opal. This Phoenix is transitional due the amount of opal, it is in between Transparent Phoenix and Phoenix.

glassitems.name: Transitional Rose Quartz
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Rose Quartz is a lovely intense pink with CFL reactivity. Under CFL it goes to a more intense electric hot pink. Transitional refers to the opal content of the color and represents the mid point between Rose Quartz and Transparent Rose Quartz.

glassitems.name: Transparent Coral
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a cadmium based semi transparent orange.

glassitems.name: Transparent Gold Purple
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A transparent royal purple. The purple in this color is brought out by fully working it in cycles of letting it cool down and reheating similar to working an opal color.

glassitems.name: Transparent Gold Purple (Unique)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A unique version of our transparent gold purple rod. This is unique due to the saturation of gold in the color and the hue before being melted. To bring out purple color must be fully worked.

glassitems.name: Transparent Marina
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A transparent non opal version of marina. This color works best in neutral to oxidizing flames, or encased.

glassitems.name: Transparent Phoenix
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Transparent Phoenix appears as a bright and rich ruby red. Very similar shade of red as standard Phoenix with a finished appearance closer to a traditional ruby red than an opal version. This is a perfect option when seeking a true transparent red that shines bright. Color can produce more of an opal effect when encased.

glassitems.name: Transparent Shifty Peach Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A transparent version of our shifty peach. Changes from peach to bright pink under cfl light.

glassitems.name: Transparent Shifty Sauce
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A transparent color that shifts from yellow to pink under CFL.

glassitems.name: Transparent Wildberry Satin (transitional)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Transparent version of Wildberry Satin.

glassitems.name: Transparent Yellow Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A yellow with light opal, use neutral flame for best results.

glassitems.name: White Satin
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Hand pulled creamy opaque white with brilliant satin and pink under UV light. Satin colors really shine when encased.

glassitems.name: Wildberry (variant)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This Wildberry variant has a slight satin effect, and stays opaque when worked. Best results in a neutral/oxidizing flame.

glassitems.name: Wildberry Satin
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Pleasing variety of Wildberry with a nice satin content. Mostly translucent color that will appear closer to opaque if kept thick, and more transparent if thinned or stretched.

glassitems.name: Yoshi
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Yoshi, a staple of the Greasy Glass collection. A vibrant green that shifts pink under CFL light.

glassitems.name: Yoshi (Milky)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Milky Yoshi, a staple of the Greasy collection. Clean and nearly opaque with a strong CFL shift. This is B grade due to streaks.Easy to work. Preheat tubing slowly in kiln to avoid cracking.

glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name: Lunar Glass – Purplish Red Opal Item ID: [LG-PRO] Item Description: Purplish Red Opal melts into a rich, transparent purple-red, offering a bold yet elegant hue with a subtle opalescent glow. This borosilicate color is smooth to work in the flame, with excellent clarity and saturation. Ideal for both solid and hollow forms, it brings a warm, jewel-toned depth to any piece. How It’s Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Silver Amber Purple
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name: Lunar Glass – Silver Amber Purple Item ID: [LG-SAP] Item Description: Unleash a spectrum of color with Silver Amber Purple, a striking borosilicate glass rod from Lunar Glass. This reactive, silver-rich color is known for its ability to transform in the flame, striking to reveal an ever-changing palette of blues, purples, reds, and warm amber-tan tones. Each piece becomes a unique work of art as the colors develop based on your flame chemistry, heat application, and kiln atmosphere. From subtle iridescence to bold multicolor shifts, Silver Amber Purple offers endless creative potential for artists who love dynamic results and painterly effects. How It’s Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Silver Dusk Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Lunar Glass Silver Dusk Opal Silver Dusk Opal by Lunar Glass brings the delicate beauty of a sunset sky to your torch. This extraordinary opal glass features a sophisticated color palette that transitions from warm coral and peachy-orange tones to cool silvery-blue highlights, creating depth and movement that captivates from every angle. What Makes Silver Dusk Opal Special: Multi-Dimensional Color Play: Watch as warm sunset hues blend seamlessly with cool silver undertones, creating a sophisticated opalescent effect that changes with light and viewing angle Excellent Workability: Formulated for smooth, predictable performance at the torch—ideal for both detailed sculptural work and bold artistic statements Striking Versatility: Perfect for organic forms, floral designs, abstract sculptures, beads, pendants, and decorative ornaments Perfect For: Sculptural flameworking and figurines Beadmaking and jewelry components Ornamental glass art Layering and encasement techniques Adding soft, sophisticated color to any glass project Artist Tips: Silver Dusk Opal works beautifully when: Layered over clear or white for enhanced opalescence Combined with complementary warm or cool tones Used in organic, flowing designs that showcase its natural color transitions

glassitems.name: Silver Lemon
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name: Lunar Glass – Silver Lemon Item ID: [LG-SilverLemon] Item Description: Crafted with precision by Lunar Glass, this stunning borosilicate rod is a true masterpiece of color and light. When struck, it reveals a mesmerizing dance of hues, transitioning from deep greens to warm tans, vibrant purples, serene blues, and bright yellows. Each strike unleashes a kaleidoscope of colors, making it perfect for artists and glassblowers seeking to elevate their creations. How It’s Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Silver Lemon Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name: Lunar Glass – Silver Lemon Opal Item ID: [LG-SLO] Item Description: Discover radiant depth and ethereal color with Silver Lemon Opal, a premium borosilicate glass rod from Lunar Glass. This clear rod strikes beautifully in both the flame and kiln, revealing a luminous opalescence with a stunning range of tans, blues, reds, and purples. Designed for both beauty and performance, Silver Lemon Opal offers exceptional stability—no cracking, no boiling, just smooth, reliable workability. Its subtle base and vibrant strike make it perfect for layered work, encasements, and detailed sculptural elements where a touch of magical color is key. How It’s Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Soraka Green Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name: Lunar Glass – Soraka Green Opal Item ID: [LG-SGO] Item Description: Soraka Green Opal by Lunar Glass is a stunning borosilicate glass rod that melts into a rich, deep opalescent green, offering a beautiful and subtle yet noticeable color transformation. As it softens and flows, it reveals a luminous, pearlescent finish that adds a sophisticated depth to any piece. Ideal for glassblowing, lampworking, and other artistic applications, Soraka Green Opal’s unique green hue with opalescent qualities creates a captivating visual effect that shifts with light and heat. With its exceptional workability and alluring color, this rod is a perfect choice for artists looking to add a touch of elegance and intrigue to their creations. How It’s Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Soraka Green Sparkle Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name: Lunar Glass – Soraka Green Sparkle Opal Item ID: [LG-SGSO] Item Description: Discover the ethereal beauty of Soraka Green Sparkle Opal, a premium borosilicate glass rod crafted by Lunar Glass. This rod melts into a mesmerizing opalescent green, with a subtle yet striking shimmer that dances in the light. Infused with fine sparkle flakes, Soraka Green delivers a radiant glow and depth, perfect for adding magic and dimension to your flame-worked creations. Ideal for both decorative and functional glass art, this rod embodies elegance and celestial charm in every swirl. How It’s Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Taixisi Blue Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name:¬† Lunar Glass Taixisi Blue Opal Item ID: [LG-TaixisiBlueOpal] Item Description: Introducing the exquisite borosilicate color rod from Lunar Glass, a captivating addition to any glass artist's toolkit. When melted, this rod transforms into a stunning transparent milky blue, reminiscent of a serene sky on a clear day. Its soft, ethereal hue adds depth and elegance to your creations, whether you're crafting intricate beads, delicate sculptures, or vibrant glassworks. How It‚Äôs Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Transparent Green Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Lunar Glass Transparent Green Opal - Product Description Luminous Transparency with Opal Magic Experience the best of both worlds with Lunar Glass Transparent Green Opal, where vibrant green transparency meets the subtle mystique of opal glass. This exceptional specialty glass offers a unique visual experience, combining the clarity that allows light to pass through with the gentle opalescence that creates depth and dimension. Key Features: Dual Visual Properties: Beautiful transparency enhanced by subtle opal characteristics Vibrant Green Tone: Rich, clear green with excellent color saturation Unique Light Interaction: Transparent base allows light passage while opal qualities add depth Superior Workability: Consistent performance with reliable color development Premium Quality: Hand-selected and inspected for optimal clarity and opal effects Perfect For: Layered work requiring both transparency and depth Nature-themed pieces needing realistic green tones Window and light-catching sculptural elements Complex beadwork with dimensional color effects Mixed media projects requiring versatile green accents Working Characteristics: Transparent Green Opal maintains its unique dual properties throughout the working process, offering the clarity of transparent glass with the added dimension of opal effects. The transparency allows for excellent light transmission while the opal qualities provide subtle depth and visual interest. Works beautifully in both solid applications and layering techniques.

glassitems.name: Venus Dark Sea Blue Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Lunar Glass Venus Dark Sea Blue Opal - Product Description Deep Ocean Mystery with Celestial Grace Dive into the profound beauty of Lunar Glass Venus Dark Sea Blue Opal, where the mysterious depths of the ocean meet the ethereal elegance of celestial inspiration. This captivating specialty glass embodies the rich, dark blue of deep sea waters enhanced by the luminous, mystical qualities of premium opal glass. Key Features: Rich Dark Blue Tone: Deep sea blue with intense color saturation Celestial Opal Finish: Luminous translucency that creates enchanting light effects Dramatic Visual Impact: Bold color presence with sophisticated depth Premium Quality: Hand-selected and inspected for consistent color and opal characteristics Excellent Working Properties: Reliable flame response with stable color development Perfect For: Ocean and water-themed sculptural works Bold statement jewelry with dramatic presence Layering techniques for deep dimensional effects Accent work requiring rich, grounding blues Mixed media projects with nautical or celestial themes Working Characteristics: Venus Dark Sea Blue Opal maintains its rich, deep coloration throughout the working process with excellent stability. The opal base creates beautiful light interaction while providing substantial opacity for solid color applications.

glassitems.name: Yellow Green Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name: Lunar Glass - Yellow Green Opal Item ID: [LG-YG-B26] Item Description: Bring subtle sophistication to your work with Yellow Green Opal by Lunar Glass. This premium borosilicate rod starts as a vibrant opaque blend of yellow and green, but once melted, it transforms into a beautifully smooth clear green with a soft yellow undertone—perfect for adding depth and nuance to your glass art. How It’s Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Yitai Green Opal
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Item name:¬† Lunar Glass Yitai Green Opal Item ID: [LG-YitaiGreenOpal] Item Description: Experience the beauty of the Lunar Glass borosilicate color rod in a mesmerizing opal green. When melted, this rod transforms into a dense, transparent opal green with a soft, slightly milky finish. Hints of yellow shimmer subtly within, adding a warm glow that enhances your artistic creations. How It‚Äôs Sold: This item is available by the LB or 1/4LB

glassitems.name: Chromium
glassitems.manufacturer_description: [R&D: EXPECT VARIATIONS FROM BATCH TO BATCH] There are no refunds or exchanges on R&D glass – all sales are final.

glassitems.name: Electrum
glassitems.manufacturer_description: [R&D: EXPECT VARIATIONS FROM BATCH TO BATCH] There are no refunds or exchanges on R&D glass – all sales are final.

glassitems.name: Neptunium
glassitems.manufacturer_description: [R&D: EXPECT VARIATIONS FROM BATCH TO BATCH] There are no refunds or exchanges on R&D glass – all sales are final.

glassitems.name: Alaska Night
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Blue-black striking color that changes into black, blue, gray, dark purple and bright blue. It’s wonderful in all applications. A fun color to work with that can develop silver reflective with a metallic sheen. Try this encased with a reducing flame.

glassitems.name: Almond Nugget
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A light almond colored glass that when encased and using an oxidizing flame has inside veils of ambers to wispy blues but become more opaque with a reducing flame. Un-encased colors are lighter amber. Pulls thin, stays creamy, and nice for deep encasements.

glassitems.name: American Beauty
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Gina Gaffner - "American Beauty is a beautiful deep dark red that can be thinned out with clear and can go along way and is super workable in all flames. This red will get super dark the longer you garage it in the kiln".

glassitems.name: Amethyst Ice
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color glass consists of two bands of plum harvest and two bands of a cream/white color. This color creates very unique effects in sculptural work; is great for quick canes for coil-pots and inside-out work. This rod makes detail very easy.

glassitems.name: Apache
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color glass is a whirl-wind of yellows, reds and oranges all separated by a bit of black. The colors are rich and intense. Easy to work and just screams out: wig-wag.

glassitems.name: Black Bird
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Black rod with beautiful rich black tone. No reducing problems as long as you work is on an oxygen-rich flame. Stays bright and dense when worked in a deep encasement. It is non-transparent, non-reflective, our darkest and least transparent black. It is a darker black than our other black, Black Rose.

glassitems.name: Black Rose
glassitems.manufacturer_description: An intense black with a dark rose violet undertone. Surface can get a little grey in heavy reducing atmosphere; recommend neutral to oxidizing flame. Black Rose is stable, durable and smooth. Thinning can result in transparent color.

glassitems.name: Blue Flambé
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Bright and lively blue and plays, beautifully as a surface color in sculpture. Work in a neutral flame, not too oxidizing for this one. Part of the beauty is in the haze that develops, yielding sky blues and purples and bright, royal blues. Generally develops beautifully just as it is works.

glassitems.name: Blue Lightning
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A cobalt based color which contains silver. This color strikes to opal with greens, blues and whites.

glassitems.name: Blue Reflection
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Striking color with a light green, blue and purple.

glassitems.name: Blue Treasure
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color glass offers blues and yellows that combine to make a wonderful murrini for flowers, jellyfish caps and realistic eyes that work best with a contrasting color. A myriad of color effects when deep encased. Experiment with this one; twisties, stringer, ghostly effects are all great. A favorite for ring making.

glassitems.name: Brisk Light Green
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Momka's newest color.

glassitems.name: Brown Glitter
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This rich sparkly brown is very saturated and works smooth. Use a slightly reduced flame or oxidizing to neutral - melts & flows smoothly. The reflection of the sparkle will pick up adjacent colors. Don’t overwork or deep encase.

glassitems.name: Caribbean Coral
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This color produces a wonderful array of color swirls varying from salmon, corals, lavenders and purples. Work this glass hot with an oxidizing flame and the metals come out to play. Flame striking produces bolder colors.

glassitems.name: Carmen Red
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Gina Gaffner - "Carmen Red when worked on a a super cold flame (high oxygen) this color comes out beautifully. Another nice trick that I find with most cad colors is preheating them in the kiln before working them in the flame. Once cad colors are nice a warm you can typically get away with a hotter flame to get nice detail work done".

glassitems.name: Challenge Cherry Blossom
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Challenge series color with pinks, reds, ambers and white can strike to deeper reds; very versatile and easy to use.

glassitems.name: Challenge Gerber Orange
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Challenge series color with vivid orange stripes is easy to use and versatile.

glassitems.name: Challenge Gerber Pink
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Challenge series color, can be cut into murrini and has versatile uses. Gerber Pink can be struck to achieve deeper color; stable in deep encasements.

glassitems.name: Challenge Gerber Red
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Challenge series color. Works well in deep encasements, but use a soft flame to avoid boiling. Like all the challenge series colors, this can be used as murrini, twisties, coil pots and the rest.

glassitems.name: Challenge Sunflower
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Challenge series yellow color, can be cut into murrini and has great versatility. Pull into various sized stringer, even very thin stringer will hold its color and make beautiful flowers. Sunflower is stable, but needs to be worked cool in deep encasement to avoid bubbling.

glassitems.name: Charles Brown
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Transparent brown. This easy to use color has a smooth consistency and is great for sculpture and color blow outs.

glassitems.name: Cherry Brandy
glassitems.manufacturer_description: An earthy red opaque color that strikes to multiple red hues. This creamy color is easy to work, but needs a neutral flame.

glassitems.name: Cinnabar
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A striking color that is a dark shade of ruby. It develops its permanent color while working and doesn’t overstrike.

glassitems.name: Cloud
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Silver, gray and yellow light tones come through a clear base. Like the sun shining through after it rains.

glassitems.name: Cobalt Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: One of the most appealing basic colors, is easy to work with and is little stiffer than other transparent colors. Cobalt can take lots of heat. Avoid reducing flame. Neutral flame works best.

glassitems.name: Crystal Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a beautiful transparent blue. Very clear blue and easy to use color. No boiling issues. Use an oxidizing flame, as you can get some slight red reductions with this glass.

glassitems.name: Encased Carmen Red
glassitems.manufacturer_description: It’s covered with clear glass and you can use it inside or out without any problem.

glassitems.name: Encased Sunshine Yellow
glassitems.manufacturer_description: It’s covered with clear glass and you can use it inside or out without any problem.

glassitems.name: Exotic Citrus Yellow
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A lemon color with some amber colors coming through. Blows out nice and easy. Friendly, easy strikingh.

glassitems.name: Exotic Citrus-Grapefruit
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Gina Gaffner - "Exotic Grapefruit Citrus is so organic I am able to use it for many fruits and veggies. I currently use it for my grapefruit pieces and my beets. The color works great in all flame types. A high propane flame will bring out the grapefruit color the most".

glassitems.name: Forget-Me-Not
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Challenge series color with blue stripes and subtle yellow centers make fantastic murrini, twisties and wraps.

glassitems.name: Green Dragon 049
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Extremely smooth semi-transparent olive green sparkling green color with pearl essence. Start with a cool flame and then this glass can take any flame well. Not appropriate with deep encasing.

glassitems.name: Green Envy
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A very rich transparent green that develops faint wispy blue under strong oxidizing flame. Neutral flame to surface color tends to opacify while interior color surfaces develop a range of colors from tan to blue. Careful not to reduce, it will give an opaque red to exposed surfaces.

glassitems.name: Green Flambé
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is one of our newest colors and is a green, blue silver color that works well in any flame and reduces well.

glassitems.name: Greener Trails
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color rod has tones of green and amber-yellow shades all separated by clear. Favorite of bead makers.

glassitems.name: Guacamole
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A nice saturated opaque green. Less yellow than Martini olive. Use a gentle neutral flame.

glassitems.name: Gypsy Queen
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color glass reds, blues, greens, and white colors. This smooth and easy to work colorful rod offers new design options. Use cool flame if you want to keep the vivid colors.

glassitems.name: Infinity
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color glass has eight distinct bands of blues, reds, green and striking colors separated by clear. Easy to use, and makes a great twisty.

glassitems.name: Infinity II (Coral Snake)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color glass has eight bands separated by clear. This one we playfully call coral snake. It is a yellow-dark blue-reddish combination that is easy to use and twists well.

glassitems.name: Infinity III -
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color glass of vibrant blue and bright yellow is stable in deep encasements, and the yellow appears more lemony. Twisties can be pulled thin and the pattern remains clear. This glass works easily in all applications.

glassitems.name: Ivy Green
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a beautiful rich opaque green. A true green, and very friendly.

glassitems.name: Lemon Yellow
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Lovely yellow color, resist boiling. Beautiful with slight translucency to it and is brilliantly easy to work. If it does boil on you a bit, just let that area cool and then dip in and out of the flame a few times. It is good is to use it as a base to lay stripes over it.

glassitems.name: Light Purple Haze
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A light transparent yellow with a purple haze which can develop a light white and yellow mix. A reducing flame will give the surface a metallic sheen. This color seems light from within.

glassitems.name: Luminous Yellow
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Luminous yellow is like the early morning light on the volcano slopes of Maui, crisp, clear and bright.

glassitems.name: Magic Mirror
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Swirling honey with wisps of blue-purple and silver reflection. Blown out it tends to be a nice amber honey color. Outside work, with an oxidizing flame, gives a slight mirroring and iridescence.

glassitems.name: Marlee
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color is a classic. Red, Yellow and Green, all separated by Obsidian.

glassitems.name: Marlee II
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Multi-color rod of classic colors – red, gold and green separated by obsidian. Each of the colors is covered with clear to prevent cracking. Use a cool flame if you want to keep these vivid colors.

glassitems.name: Martini Olive
glassitems.manufacturer_description: It is the lighter of our two opaque greens. Care must be taken to prevent boiling. Use a neutral flame.

glassitems.name: Matador
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color glass has two stripes of dark black, two stripes of red with thin separations of creamy white color. This bold color is easy to work and does best in a neutral flame; great in all applications.

glassitems.name: Moonlight Sonata
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color rod has wonderful hues of blues, reds, whites and greens with a wispy pearly stripe. This glass works great in all applications. Moonlight Sonata makes a fast and beautiful cane when twisted.

glassitems.name: Obsidian
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A strong dark cobalt blue that does not thin out. Avoid reducing flame. Neutral flame works best.

glassitems.name: Orchard Plum
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This new multi-color has delightful amber-rose to plum with swirls of blue and silver. Very smooth consistency and good in all applications.

glassitems.name: Palitra Orange
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Each rod from Sunset Orange is covered separately with clear glass. Works easy inside or out.

glassitems.name: Purple Thunder
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a strong striking purple; very easy to strike. Beautiful pinks, rose, blue, creams and purples. Use an oxidizing flame. Best results are with some flame striking.

glassitems.name: Rainbow Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A dark blue glass with violet overtones. Work in a neutral flame and finish with a light reduction.

glassitems.name: Rhapsody in Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This multi-color rod contains a symphony of cool hues of blues, emeralds and teals that dance and swirl through the rod. This glass works well inside and out, encased or not and makes a great twistie.

glassitems.name: Silky Satin Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A very stable semi transparent blue with a touch of green that works easily in all flames. When encased has a light silky sheen.

glassitems.name: Silver Beach
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A fast striking purple that is great for all applications. Oxidizing and neutral flames will give you dark purples, amber, yellows and blues. Silver Beach has stable color in deep encasement. Experimentation can yield surprising colors in pink, peach and green.

glassitems.name: Silver Iris
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Is a beautiful dark purple with lots of silver that is not affected by strong oxidizing / reduction flame. Get lovely blue/purple haze with annealing. The color intensity increases in larger work with more vivid colors. A popular color combo is Silver Iris and Magic Mirror.

glassitems.name: Silver Pine
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a nice opaque green with silver in it. You can achieve some lovely blue and green transparent luster's.

glassitems.name: Sparkly Green
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Smooth light transparent color with a lot of sparkling green. Work middle to cool flame. Slight oxidizing works best. Strikes with light tones to blue and yellow.

glassitems.name: Sunset Orange
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Gina Gaffner - "Sunset Orange hangs strong with the rest of the cadmium colors Momka's has to offer. Stable and easy to work with no worry of boiling. It is super dense as well".

glassitems.name: Violet Hue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: It's a fun color to work with, because so many effects are possible. Working it slowly in a neutral to reducing atmosphere gives you hazy purples and greens and milky colors. Working fast in a hot, oxidizing environment gives you corals and raspberry reds, with some purple highlights.

glassitems.name: Violet Iris
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Transparent purple/violet with a lot less silver than Silver Iris. This is a great color for thick applications, sculptural work, and blow-outs.

glassitems.name: Violet Medley
glassitems.manufacturer_description: An artist's favorite striking color. The rod is a funky avocado green and is worked like any amber purple by heating to white hot and keeping the surface haze burned off. When the piece is finished let it cool till the orange glow is gone and then strike to purples by reintroducing the piece to the outermost portion of the flame. Areas that have had the haze burned off will turn a rich dark transparent purple and areas that the haze is left on show up as a pretty cloudy blue. It is very easy to flame strike.

glassitems.name: Yellow Pearl
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Gina Gaffner - "Yellow Pearl is a perfect color to layer over another to create organic texture. I love layering it with colors to create the juicy insides of many of my fruit and veggie pieces. This color seems to get a little darker when garaged in the kiln for a long time".

glassitems.name: Absinthe
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This color will thin out if used in stringer form but will hold a gem quality vibrant green that is unaffected by flame chemistry when worked in more solid applications.

glassitems.name: Alaskan Thunder
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-111 Alaskan Thunder is a black blue silver color. When worked in an oxidizing flame, NS-111 Alaskan Thunder yields bright metallic blues, greens, and purples. When worked in a neutral flame it yields bright hazy green, white, and cream colors. When worked in a heavily reducing flame NS-111 Alaskan Thunder produces a nice ash gray. It is well suited for stringer application, blown work, and sculpture. Try encasing NS-111 Alaskan Thunder with clear or NS-09 Yellow for great effects.

glassitems.name: Amber Purple
glassitems.manufacturer_description: You will only be billed for the final weight sent that is equal to or less than the amount ordered.

glassitems.name: Amber/Purple
glassitems.manufacturer_description: The color can produce pale yellows to ambers to a deep purple. To yield the most vibrant purples, work in a hot neutral to slightly oxidizing flame. Reduction will affect the strike. Try encasing your favorite Amber/Purple with NS-032 Violet, or NS-031 Lavender. To enhance NS-013 Amber/Purple try backing it with NS-054 Star White.

glassitems.name: Amber/Purple 2mm 3mm
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-013 Amber/Purple: Of the striking colors in the borosilicate palette the Amber/purples are some of the most exciting. NS-013 is the first in a series of five Amber/Purple colors. It is well suited for sculpture and moderately thin blown work.

glassitems.name: Aurora
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-047 Aurora is the most unique member of the exotic family. It is the most versatile of the group and produces a wide array of colors from deep magentas and fuchsias to greens and fiery browns. When worked in a highly oxidizing flame Aurora produces deep purples and blues. When worked in a neutral flame Aurora yields bright greens and ambers. When heavily reduced the reds and browns appear. It is well suited for stringer applications and blown work. It looks great cased with clear. Also be sure to try encasing Aurora with NS-013 Amber/Purple.

glassitems.name: Berry Gumbolt
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-103 Berry Gumbolt is a fully opaque saturated dark blue. It is well suited for stringer application and blown work. It is not susceptible to reduction and is not flame sensitive. For best results keep it in a neutral flame. It is a great backing for such colors as NS-14 Irrid and NS-15 Turquesa, and goes well with NS-63 Canary.

glassitems.name: Black Lightning
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-100 Black Lightning is a very dense black with silver. NS-100 Black Lightning can yield a mirror like blue metallic finish or if over-reduced an organic earthy tone. To keep NS-100 Black Lightning most vibrant, work in a super oxidizing environment until you are finished with the piece. Then, turn the flame down and bathe the piece in a super reducing flame for several seconds to produce the mirror like sheen. For another great effect, encase NS- 100 Black Lightning with clear. This color can be stretched out and is great for blown work. If heavily encased, be sure to anneal thoroughly. This is the bigger brother of NS-111 Alaskan Thunder.

glassitems.name: Blue Caramel
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-081 Blue Caramel is a lush high intensity silvery striking color. If worked in a super oxidizing flame it will yield smoky blues and greens. If reduced, it provides the user with an extremely silvery tan color. If encased, the color turns to be a brilliant metallic green. It is easy to work and is well suited for stringer applications and blown work. Popular product for cold working the surface. Charges will be adjusted to match final product weight

glassitems.name: Blue Caramel
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-081 Blue Caramel is a lush high intensity silvery striking color. If worked in a super oxidizing flame it will yield smoky blues and greens. If reduced it provides the user with an extremely silvery tan color. If encased, the color turns to be a brilliant metallic green. It is easy to work and is well suited for stringer applications and blown work. Try layering NS-066 Sublime over the surface for a wonderful green effect!

glassitems.name: Blue Caramel 2mm 3mm
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A rich buttery striking color. Keep it oxidized for hazy blues and greens. Reduce for the most scintillating mirror-like sheen.

glassitems.name: Blue Exotic
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Blue Exotic Rods

glassitems.name: Blue Green
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-038 Intense Blue Green is the more saturated version of NS-015 Turquesa. It is a vibrant striking semi opaque blue. When oxidized, Intense Blue Green yields a rich smoky blue strike. When worked in a neutral environment NS-038 produces bright metallic greens. When reduced, this color produces hazy gray tones. It looks great when cased with clear, and try layering NS-005 over the surface. To make the strike even more vibrant, back NS-038 with NS-054 Star White.

glassitems.name: Blue Moon
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-045 Blue Moon is a favorite striking color in the Northstar palette. When worked in an oxidizing flame Blue Moon yields bright metallic blues. When worked in a neutral flame it yields bright hazy greens. When worked in a heavily reducing flame Blue Moon produces a nice ash gray. It is well suited for stringer application, blown work, and sculpture. Be sure to try encasing NS-045 Blue Moon with clear or NS-009 Yellow for great effects.

glassitems.name: Blue Moon 2mm 3mm
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A saturated striking color. Oxidize for brilliant blues and greens. Reduce for sea greens and matte grays. Beautiful range of color when encased.

glassitems.name: Blue Moon Fore
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Northstar Fore Powder is a byproduct of frit production. Fore Powder is a very fine crushed up glass with a range of grit size from 70-100 mesh. NS-045 Blue Moon is a favorite striking color in the Northstar palette. When worked in an oxidizing flame Blue Moon yields bright metallic blues. When worked in a neutral flame it yields bright hazy greens. When worked in a heavily reducing flame Blue Moon produces a nice ash gray. It is well suited for stringer application, blown work, and sculpture. Be sure to try encasing NS-045 Blue Moon with clear or NS-009 Yellow for great effects. No refunds or returns on this product.

glassitems.name: Blue Spruce
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-079 Blue Spruce: Just as trees have growth rings; Blue Spruce will develop regular steely blue striations on the surface of the glass. Reduction develops these striations or rings. If kept oxidized, Blue Spruce will remain pure and offers a fully saturated blue-green opaque for stringers and blown work. Try reducing, then casing with clear glass for a neat effect! Amber/Purples look great with NS-079 Blue Spruce as well. This color is a must have in any palette.

glassitems.name: Blue Spruce Fore
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Northstar Fore Powder is a byproduct of frit production. Fore Powder is a very fine crushed up glass with a range of grit size from 70-100 mesh. NS-079 Blue Spruce is a great opaque blue/green. If kept oxidized, Blue Spruce will remain pure and offers a fully saturated opaque blue-green. Reduce for interesting striations that appear as rings. No refunds or returns on this product.

glassitems.name: Blue Thunder
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-122 Blue Thunder is a dark cobalt blue color with silver. When worked in an oxidizing flame NS-122 Blue Thunder yields bright metallic blues. When worked in a neutral flame it yields bright hazy greens. When worked in a heavily reducing flame NS-122 Blue Thunder produces a nice ash gray. It is well suited for stringer application, blown work, and sculpture. NS-122 Blue Thunder is a lighter version of NS-45 Blue Moon with the same working values.

glassitems.name: Brillo
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Brillo is a beautiful steel grey transparent sparkle that can be used all by itself or mixed with any color to add sparkle, try layering Brillo over other colors to add sparkle. We recommend using and oxidized flame setting to cut down on boiling. Layer NS-134 Over NS-20 for an amazing steel blue color or layered over NS-88 for that candy apple red paint job.

glassitems.name: Bubblegum
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-062 Bubblegum is a fully opaque flamingo pink. It is atmospherically stable so it can be worked in any flame without the color being affected. It is flame sensitive so heat it gently in a soft flame. Once it is heated Bubblegum will take a lot of heat without any boiling issues. Bubblegum is a great backing color and well suited for sculpture. Try it as a backing for NS-013 Amber/Purple, or NS-026 Double Amber/Purple. It is also a great backing for gold fume.

glassitems.name: Butterscotch
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-041 Butterscotch is a semi opaque buttery tan color. It can yield rich purplish blue tones and silver hues. When kept in a more oxidizing environment more of the blues and purples will appear. If reduced, a silvery haze will appear on the surface. Butterscotch is easy to work and can take a lot of heat making it a forgiving striking color. It can be stretched out and is good for blown work and sculpture. If you are looking for something even more intense, try NS-044 Caramel.

glassitems.name: Butterscotch Fats
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-041 Butterscotch is a semi opaque buttery tan color. These Butterscotch Fats range in diameter from 8mm-11mm & have limited availability. These rods can yield rich purplish blue tones and silver hues. When kept in a more oxidizing environment more of the blues and purples will appear. If reduced, a silvery haze will appear on the surface. Butterscotch is easy to work and can take a lot of heat making it a forgiving striking color.

glassitems.name: Butterscotch Off Color/ Unique
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A versatile striking color. Oxidize for creamy hues. Reduce for a slight silvery tone and deeper browns.

glassitems.name: Canary
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-063 Canary is a bright intense opaque lemon yellow. It is eye catching and is well suited for stringer application, and blown work. It is not terribly sensitive to flame chemistry but stay out of overly reducing flames. Canary however is heat sensitive so it must be worked carefully to prevent boiling. Encasing with clear is another method to shielding the color, but not necessary. Canary can be easily worked on the surface and will not boil or scar if worked carefully in a soft flame. For a nice color effect layer NS-009 Yellow over NS-063 Canary.

glassitems.name: Canary
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-063 Canary is a bright intense opaque lemon yellow. It is eye catching and is well suited for stringer application, and blown work. It is not terribly sensitive to flame chemistry but stay out of overly reducing flames. Canary however is heat sensitive so it must be worked carefully to prevent boiling. Encasing with clear is another method to shielding the color, but not necessary. Canary can be easily worked on the surface and will not boil or scar if worked carefully in a soft flame. For a nice color effect layer NS-009 Yellow over NS-063 Canary.

glassitems.name: Canary 2mm 3mm
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A bright Intense Opaque yellow. Work slowly in a cool oxidizing flame to prevent boiling. See the Heat Sensitive color section.

glassitems.name: Canary Dark
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is an slightly dark Canary yellow off-color. Work slowly in a cool oxidizing flame to prevent boiling. See the Heat Sensitive color section.

glassitems.name: Canary Fore
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Northstar Fore Powder is a byproduct of frit production. Fore Powder is a very fine crushed up glass with a range of grit size from 70-100 mesh. NS-063 Canary is a bright intense opaque lemon yellow. It is not terribly sensitive to flame chemistry but stay out of overly reducing flames. Canary however is heat sensitive so it must be worked carefully to prevent boiling. Encasing with clear is another method to shielding the color, but not necessary. Canary can be easily worked on the surface and will not boil or scar if worked carefully in a soft flame. For a nice color effect layer NS-009 Yellow over NS-063 Canary. No refunds or returns on this product.

glassitems.name: Canary Light
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This is a unique off shade of standard NS-063 Canary. available only while supplies last.

glassitems.name: Caramel
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-044 Caramel is a more intense version of NS-041 Butterscotch. It is a rich silvery tan color that can be stretched out thin. It is great for stringer application and blown work. Work in a hot neutral to oxidizing flame for bright tan colors. To bring out the silvery mirror like sheen bathe the piece in a reducing flame. Be sure to try NS-007 Ruby or NS-013 Amber/Purple over NS-044 Caramel.

glassitems.name: Cherry
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-065 Cherry is the most eye-catching member of the intense opaque family. It is a bright candy apple red that is well suited for stringer application and blown work. Cherry is slightly sensitive to reduction, so work in a soft neutral flame. Cherry is however heat sensitive so it must be worked carefully to prevent boiling. Encasing with clear is another method to shielding the color, but not necessary. Cherry can be easily worked on the surface and will not boil or scar if worked carefully in a soft flame. A nice color effect to try is a layer of NS-037 Rootbeer over NS-065 Cherry.

glassitems.name: Cherry 2mm 3mm
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A bright Intense Opaque red. Work slowly in a cool oxidizing flame to prevent boiling. See the Heat Sensitive color section.

glassitems.name: Cherry Dark
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This dark off-shade Cherry is a perfect red to fade from NS-65 Cherry into EXP #70 Cadmium Blood Red. Work slowly in a cool oxidizing flame to prevent boiling. See the Heat Sensitive color section. Limited supply available. $60/lb

glassitems.name: Cherry Fore
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Northstar Fore Powder is a byproduct of frit production. Fore Powder is a very fine crushed up glass with a range of grit size from 70-100 mesh. NS-065 Cherry is a bright Intense Opaque red. Work slowly in a cool oxidizing flame to prevent boiling. Cherry is heat sensitive so it must be worked carefully & slowly in a cool oxidizing flame to prevent boiling. Encasing with clear is another method to shielding the color, but not necessary. Cherry can be easily worked on the surface and will not boil or scar if worked carefully in a soft flame. A nice color effect to try is a layer of NS-037 Rootbeer over NS-065 Cherry. No refunds or returns on this product.

glassitems.name: Cherry Light
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This light off-color Cherry has slightly orange/red hue similar to NS-085 Poppy. Work slowly in a cool oxidizing flame to prevent boiling. See the Heat Sensitive color section.

glassitems.name: Clear
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Clear Frit

glassitems.name: Cobalt Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-001 Of the four shades of cobalt blue Northstar produces, this ranks as the second lightest. NS-001 is well suited for small blown work, as well as sculpture when a medium transparent blue is desired. NS-001 Cobalt Blue can take a lot of heat and can be worked in a wide range of flame settings. Though the color is extremely intense, be sure to stay out of reducing flames to prevent any dulling or graying.

glassitems.name: Cobalt Fore
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Northstar Fore Powder is a byproduct of frit production. Fore Powder is a very fine crushed up glass with a range of grit size from 70-100 mesh. NS-001 is well suited for small blown work, as well as sculpture when a medium transparent blue is desired. NS-001 Cobalt Blue can take a lot of heat and can be worked in a wide range of flame settings. Though the color is extremely intense, be sure to stay out of reducing flames to prevent any dulling or graying. No refunds or returns on this product.

glassitems.name: Crystal Bliss
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-123 Crystal Bliss is a light cobalt blue with lots of sparkle. The color is not heat sensitive and works great. NS-123 Crystal Bliss is very light in color and when pulled thin, the color will fade to clear. We created NS-123 Crystal Bliss the artists that like to coat their colors with sparkle. Use an oxidizing flame to cut down on red lines of copper.

glassitems.name: Crystal Bliss Off Color
glassitems.manufacturer_description: This Crystal Bliss Off-Color yielded with little to no sparkle, therefore the color is a unique off shade light cobalt. The color is not heat sensitive and works great.

glassitems.name: Dark Amethyst
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-106 Dark Amethyst is a light transparent violet color. This is a “what you see is what you get” color. Use in a slightly neutral to oxidizing flame for best results. NS-106 Dark Amethyst works like butter so do not hesitate to spread it over other colors. The color looks best in solid color blowouts and sculpture work. Stringers tend to lose color and may appear as a clear Violet.

glassitems.name: Dark Blue Amber/Purple
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-049 Dark Blue Amber/Purple is the more intense version of Light/Blue Amber Purple. It yields a more intense semi opaque strike and has more of a blue tint. Due to its intensity it is useful for thin blown work and cane applications. Work Dark Blue Amber/Purple in a hot neutral to slightly oxidizing flame. Reduction will affect the strike. Dark Blue Amber/Purple’s strike is amplified by a backing of NS-054 Star White.

glassitems.name: Dark Cobalt
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-020 Dark Cobalt is the second most saturated of the four shades of cobalt blue Northstar produces. Dark Cobalt is well suited for thin blown work and cane work. Because of its intensity it must be worked in an oxidizing flame to prevent graying.

glassitems.name: Dark Garnet
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-087 Garnet Dark is the most saturated self striking Ruby Northstar currently offers. It is best suited for thin stringer, thin blown work, and lip wraps. The self striking rubies are the next generation of colors offering the user cleaner purer colors with less air and difficulty in working. When working NS-087 Garnet Dark use a hot oxidizing flame. Once hot NS-087 Garnet Dark will turn transparent just as the standard Northstar rubies, but as it cools it turns a uniform ruby red. The strike is easily repeatable and the final color is not affected by kilning. Even after numerous reheats no liviering will occur. Note the final shade of red is slightly darker than the initial color of the rod. Once heated and allowed to strike, the final color can be viewed. After prolonged use in sculptural and inside out applications NS-087 Garnet Dark can develop a deep brown hue. This can usually be reversed by heating the color until molten.

glassitems.name: Dark Multi
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-004 Dark Multi is the more intense version of NS-003 Multi and will yield similar effects, but much more pronounced.

glassitems.name: Dark Multi Fore
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Northstar Fore Powder is a byproduct of frit production. Fore Powder is a very fine crushed up glass with a range of grit size from 70-100 mesh. When worked in an oxidizing flame Dark Multi produces metallic blues and sea greens. When reduced, NS-004 Multi yields earthy reds and browns. Because it is more saturated it will react much more quickly to the particular chemistry of the flame. Due to the fact that it reacts more readily, do not over reduce. To yield other interesting effects, try encasing NS-004 Multi with clear or backing it with an opaque color. No refunds or returns on this product.

glassitems.name: Dark Orange
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-006 Dark Orange is a more saturated version of NS-005 Orange. It is well suited for thin blown work, cane work, or when a deep semi-opaque orange is desired. Because it is more saturated, be sure to work in an oxidizing flame to prevent muddying. Due to the fact that it strikes more quickly than NS-006-Orange, NS-006 Dark Orange can be flame struck. For more information about NS-006 Orange refer to Northstar Newsletter 8.

glassitems.name: Dark Ruby
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-008 Dark Ruby is the most saturated of the transparent striking rubies Northstar produces. It must be worked in a hot oxidizing flame to prevent liveriness. Because it is so intense it can be easily flame struck. It is most useful for small sculptural accents, cane work, and stringers. When fully struck, it can yield a rich opaque Chinese red. For additional information about NS-008 Dark Ruby refer to Northstar Newsletter 8

glassitems.name: Deep Sea Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-077 Deep Sea Blue is a fully opaque saturated blue. It is well suited for stringer application and blown work. For those of you searching for a substitute for NS-022 Polaris, this is the closest color to it. It is not susceptible to reduction and is not flame sensitive. For best results keep it in a neutral flame. It is a great backing for such colors as NS-014 Irrid and NS-015 Turquesa, and goes well with NS-063 Canary.

glassitems.name: Double Amber/Purple
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-026 Double Amber/Purple is the more intense version of NS-013 Amber/Purple. It produces the most exciting metallic purples and vermilions. It behaves similarly in the flame as regular Amber/Purple but because of its greater intensity more care has to be taken to prevent reduction. Double Amber/Purple can be stretched further and can be blown relatively thin without losing the vibrant purple strike. Be sure to try layering Double Amber/Purple over NS-081 Blue Caramel.

glassitems.name: Egyptian White Sand
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-094 Egyptian White Sand is a rich opaque color reminiscent of elephant ivory or the bleached carved hieroglyphic tablets excavated from ancient Egypt. It is not sensitive to flame chemistry but must be worked in a soft gentle heat to prevent surface scarring and boiling. Once worked, the color can be heated more rapidly and take a larger volume of heat. The key is working the color slowly until it is melted in smooth. It is a formulation based on our NS-054 Star White but one that offers even greater opacity and intensity. NS-094 Eqyptian White Sand’s antiqued color and grainy texture is ideal for shading in sculptural applications such as murrini cane, while its intensity allows for its application in extremely thin blown work. It is also an ideal background color.

glassitems.name: English Ivy
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-131 English Ivy is a light transparent aquamarine color, that when used in the flame, can yield many color hues. This color is in the same family as NS-13 Amber Purple and NS-03 Multi so the color possibilities are endless. NS-131 English Ivy produces metallic blues and sea greens. When reduced, this color can yield earthy reds and browns. We recommend using an oxidizing flame to achieve the most vivid color. Because it is more saturated than NS-13 Amber Purple and NS-03 Multi it will react much more quickly to the particular chemistry of the flame so be careful not to over reduce. To yield other interesting effects, try encasing NS-131 English Ivy with clear or backing it with an opaque color like NS-54 Star White. This color can be stretched thin, so it is well suited for delicate blown work, stringer application, and cane work.

glassitems.name: Evergreen
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-097 Evergreen is more dark than its NS-053 Forest Green counterpart, Evergreen is smooth and creamy. A neutral flame is the best when working this color but can be worked in practically any flame without fear of discoloration. It works well for encased applications. It is great for stringer applications and thin blown work. Try using it next to NS-053 Forest Green and NS-011 Jade for a beautiful green fade.

glassitems.name: Exp Green #5
glassitems.manufacturer_description: When working NS-127 EXP Green #5 you can achieve many different colors. When used in an oxidizing flame the color will stay a very vivid neon emerald green. Use in a less hot flame to achieve an opaque blue similar to NS-45 Blue Moon. NS-127 EXP Green #5 can also shift to a creamy white and lime green. NS-127 EXP Green #5 needs to be tried as it is hard to explain.

glassitems.name: Extra Light Yellow
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-034 Extra Light Yellow is a diluted version of NS-009 Yellow. It can be worked in virtually any flame without the color being affected. It is great for sculpture and as an overlay. By adding Extra Light Yellow over opaque colors a bluish hazy glow is added to the piece. Try it over NS-033 Turbo Cobalt!

glassitems.name: Forest Green
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-053 Forest Green is a very saturated, fully opaque green that just might be the most versatile green in the market today. It can be worked in any flame without fear of discoloration. It is recommended to stay in a neutral flame. It works well for encased applications. It is great for stringer applications and thin blown work. For a neat effect, try layering NS-003 Multi over NS-053 Forest Green.

glassitems.name: Forest Green 2mm 3mm
glassitems.manufacturer_description: A bright fully opaque green. Work in an oxidizing flame and heat slowly. It can boil if heated aggressively. See the Heat Sensitive color section.

glassitems.name: Forest Green Fore
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Northstar Fore Powder is a byproduct of frit production. Fore Powder is a very fine crushed up glass with a range of grit size from 70-100 mesh.

glassitems.name: Galaxy
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-152 Galaxy was formulated from the iconic NS-125 Jet Black base along with the amazing sparkle from the TAG Stardust family. Very durable & easy to use with a beautiful balance of dense black and heavy sparkle. Galaxy has been proven to be safe for encasement. Use an oxidizing flame to prevent any graying caused from reductive environment.

glassitems.name: Galaxy
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-152 Galaxy is the first collaborative effort between Northstar Glass & Trautman Art Glass to produce a new color in rod. This color was formulated from the iconic NS-125 Jet Black base along with the amazing sparkle from the TAG Stardust family. Very durable & easy to use with a beautiful balance of dense black and heavy sparkle. Safe for encasement, though not recommended for millefiori or deep encasement. Use an oxidizing flame to prevent any gray streaks caused from reductive environment. Choose quantity in 1/2 pound increments

glassitems.name: Galaxy 2mm 3mm
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-152 Galaxy is a collaborative effort between Northstar Glass & Trautman Art Glass. This color was formulated from the iconic NS-125 Jet Black base along with the amazing sparkle from the TAG Stardust family. Very durable & easy to use with a beautiful balance of dense black and heavy sparkle. Safe for encasement, though not recommended for millefiori or deep encasement. Use an oxidizing flame to prevent any gray streaks caused from reductive environment.

glassitems.name: Galaxy FATS (10 15mm)
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Limited run product, available only while supplies last

glassitems.name: Garnet
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-086 Garnet is a member the self striking ruby family. Garnet is the medium intensity shade of the three shades of self striking rubies Northstar currently offers. It is best suited for medium thickness blown work and highlights. The self striking rubies are the next generation of colors offering the user cleaner purer colors with less air and difficulty in working. When using NS-086 Garnet, do so in a neutral to oxidizing flame. Once hot Garnet will turn transparent just as the standard Northstar rubies, but as it cools it turns a uniform ruby red. The strike is easily repeatable and the final color is not affected by kilning. Even after numerous reheats no liviering will occur. Note the final shade of red is slightly darker than the initial color of the rod. Once heated and allowed to strike, the final color can be viewed. After prolonged use in sculptural and inside out applications NS-086 Garnet can develop a deep brown hue. This can usually be reversed by heating the color until molten. For a great color effect try layering NS-086 Garnet over NS-085 Poppy.

glassitems.name: Garnet Dark Fore
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Northstar Fore Powder is a byproduct of frit production. Fore Powder is a very fine crushed up glass with a range of grit size from 70-100 mesh. NS-087 Garnet Dark is the most saturated self striking Ruby Northstar currently offers. Work in an oxidizing flame. It will not liver, but it can develop a brown hue if overworked. Kilning will not affect the strike. No refunds or returns on this product.

glassitems.name: Gemini
glassitems.manufacturer_description: Gemini Rods

glassitems.name: Ghost
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-154 Ghost is Northstar’s newest addition to the permanent palette and is a part of our newest line of colors, “the Future Line”. Made from batch in Portland, OR and formulated with the easy working characteristics of Secret White and air free quality of Opaline to achieve a highly workable and smooth opalescent white. Our intent with this experiment is to supply artists with best material at affordable cost. Safe for deep encasements and works great in all flame atmospheres.

glassitems.name: Glacier Blue
glassitems.manufacturer_description: NS-071 Glacier Blue is a darker version of NS-070 Ice Blue. It has a green tint to the color and like NS-070 Ice Blue; Glacier adds great optical depth even in thin layers.
